description: NHS Knowledge Graph Taxonomy for entity extraction and classification

categories.name: Topic
categories.description: Subject matter categories for health content

items.label: Addiction
items.description: Information related to substance abuse, dependence, and addiction treatment, including alcohol, drugs, and behavioral addictions.

items.label: Advanced clinical practice
items.description: Resources and information related to advanced clinical practice roles, such as advanced nurse practitioners, physician associates, and other advanced healthcare professionals.

items.label: Antimicrobial resistance
items.description: Content focused on the growing problem of antimicrobial resistance, strategies for prevention, and responsible use of antibiotics and other antimicrobial agents.

items.label: Armed forces
items.description: Information pertaining to the healthcare and wellbeing of armed forces personnel, veterans, and their families.

items.label: Cancer
items.description: Information and resources regarding cancer prevention, diagnosis, treatment, research, and support services.

items.label: Children and young people
items.description: Content related to the health and wellbeing of children and young people, including physical, mental, and social aspects.

items.label: Community care
items.description: Resources pertaining to healthcare services delivered in community settings, such as homes, clinics, and community centers.

items.label: Cosmetic procedures
items.description: Information concerning cosmetic procedures, including surgical and non-surgical treatments, regulations, and ethical considerations.

items.label: Covid 19
items.description: Information, guidance, research, and updates specifically related to the COVID-19 pandemic.

items.label: Critical care
items.description: Information on the management of critically ill patients in intensive care units and other critical care settings.

items.label: Dementia
items.description: Resources related to dementia, including diagnosis, care, support, and research.

items.label: Digital skills
items.description: Content focusing on the development and enhancement of digital skills for healthcare professionals and patients.

items.label: End of life care
items.description: Information concerning palliative care, hospice care, and support for patients and families facing the end of life.

items.label: Genomics
items.description: Resources related to genomics and its application in healthcare, including genetic testing, personalized medicine, and genomic research.

items.label: Global health
items.description: Content focused on health issues and challenges that transcend national borders, including international collaborations and health disparities.

items.label: Health academia
items.description: Information related to health-related academic research, education, and training programs.

items.label: Health inequalities
items.description: Content focusing on disparities in health outcomes and access to healthcare based on factors such as socioeconomic status, ethnicity, and geographic location.

items.label: Infection management
items.description: Resources and information regarding the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of infections in healthcare settings.

items.label: Knowledge management
items.description: Content related to the organization, storage, and sharing of knowledge and information within the healthcare sector.

items.label: Learning disability and autism
items.description: Information and resources concerning the care and support of individuals with learning disabilities and autism.

items.label: Long term conditions
items.description: Content related to the management of chronic diseases and long-term health conditions.

items.label: Maternity
items.description: Resources pertaining to pregnancy, childbirth, and postnatal care.

items.label: Medicines optimisation
items.description: Information focused on improving the safety, effectiveness, and efficiency of medication use.

items.label: Mental health
items.description: Content related to mental health conditions, treatment, and support services.

items.label: Neonatal
items.description: Resources focused on the care of newborn infants, especially those who are premature or have medical complications.

items.label: NHS Screening Services
items.description: Information about the various screening programs offered by the NHS for early detection of diseases.

items.label: Personalised care
items.description: Content regarding tailoring healthcare to individual needs and preferences.

items.label: Prevention and public health
items.description: Resources and information on preventing diseases and promoting public health through various interventions and strategies.

items.label: Primary care
items.description: Information related to healthcare services provided by general practitioners and other primary care providers.

items.label: Quality
items.description: Content focusing on quality improvement initiatives and standards in healthcare.

items.label: Sexual and reproductive health
items.description: Resources pertaining to sexual health, contraception, and reproductive health services.

items.label: Urgent and emergency care
items.description: Information related to the provision of urgent and emergency medical care.

items.label: Workforce planning
items.description: Information about planning and forecasting the healthcare workforce needs, including skills, shortages, and recruitment.

items.label: Workforce transformation
items.description: Information about transforming the healthcare workforce to meet changing demands and improve care delivery, involving technology, and skill uplift.

items.label: Advanced critical care practitioners
items.description: Professionals who are equipped to deal with emergencies in critical care, working in a multi disciplinary team.

items.label: Allied health professionals
items.description: This includes the following occupations that all work within the NHS.

items.label: Ambulance service team
items.description: Includes all staff within the ambulance service who respond to and deal with medical emergencies.

items.label: Dental professionals
items.description: Including dentist and dental nurses, professional responsible for dealing with dental health issues and performing procedures.

items.label: Health informaticians
items.description: IT jobs within healthcare that are linked to data collection and presentation, often with a focus on improving efficiency.

items.label: Healthcare scientists
items.description: Scientists working within the NHS often analysing samples and interpreting results in a laboratory.

items.label: Management professionals
items.description: Administrative roles within the NHS focused on running a healthcare institution, a team or project.

items.label: Medical associate professionals
items.description: Medical professionals with varied specialities who operate under medical supervision but are not a doctor or nurse.

items.label: Medical doctors professionals
items.description: Medical doctors with a varied range of specialities.

items.label: Midwife
items.description: A healthcare professional trained to assist women during pregnancy, childbirth, and the postpartum period.

items.label: Nurses
items.description: Registered nurses who provide direct patient care in various settings.

items.label: Pharmacy professionals
items.description: Professionals dedicated to dispensing medication and delivering pharmaceutical advice and treatment.

items.label: Psychological professionals
items.description: Professional focused on improving psychological health and wellbeing.

items.label: Public health professionals
items.description: Professionals that provide public health information and advice at a local and national level.

items.label: Advocacy
items.description: Supporting and promoting the rights and interests of patients and healthcare professionals.

items.label: Apprenticeship
items.description: Structured training programs combining on-the-job experience with formal education.

items.label: Artificial intelligence and robotics
items.description: Application of AI and robotics to improve healthcare processes and outcomes.

items.label: Authentication
items.description: Verifying the identity of users and ensuring secure access to healthcare systems.

items.label: Best practice
items.description: Evidence-based guidelines and recommendations for optimal clinical and administrative practices.

items.label: Blended learning
items.description: Combining online and in-person learning methods for healthcare education and training.

items.label: Board development
items.description: Training and support for healthcare organization boards to improve governance and decision-making.

items.label: Bursaries grants and awards
items.description: Financial assistance programs to support healthcare education, research, and professional development.

items.label: Cataloguing
items.description: Organizing and describing health information resources for easy retrieval.

items.label: Circulation and counter activities
items.description: Managing the lending and return of physical resources in healthcare libraries.

items.label: Collaboration and partnership
items.description: Working with other organizations and stakeholders to achieve common healthcare goals.

items.label: Consultation
items.description: Seeking expert advice and feedback on healthcare policies, programs, and practices.

items.label: COVID 19
items.description: Information specifically related to the COVID 19 pandemic.

items.label: Continuing professional development
items.description: Ongoing learning activities to maintain and enhance healthcare professionals' skills and knowledge.

items.label: Copyright and licensing
items.description: Legal aspects of using and sharing copyrighted health information resources.

items.label: Databases
items.description: Collections of health information organized for efficient searching and retrieval.

items.label: Development needs
items.description: Identifying and addressing the training and skill gaps of healthcare professionals.

items.label: Digital capability frameworks
items.description: Frameworks for assessing and developing digital skills in the healthcare workforce.

items.label: Digital health leadership
items.description: Strategies and skills for leading digital transformation initiatives in healthcare organizations.

items.label: Digital literacy
items.description: The ability to use digital tools and technologies effectively in healthcare settings.

items.label: Digital roles and career pathways
items.description: Defining roles and career paths for healthcare professionals with digital skills.

items.label: Discovery
items.description: Tools and methods for finding health information resources.

items.label: Electronic resources
items.description: Health information resources available in digital formats.

items.label: Emerging technology
items.description: New and innovative technologies with potential applications in healthcare.

items.label: Equality impact and diversity
items.description: Assessing the impact of healthcare policies and programs on different population groups and promoting diversity.

items.label: Evaluation framework
items.description: Frameworks for assessing the effectiveness of healthcare interventions and programs.

items.label: Events
items.description: Health events such as conferences and workshops.

items.label: Evidence and knowledge self assessments
items.description: Tools for healthcare professionals to assess their knowledge and skills in specific areas.

items.label: Fellowships and scholarships
items.description: Financial support for advanced training and research in healthcare.

items.label: Finance
items.description: Information related to healthcare finance.

items.label: Graduates
items.description: Healthcare graduates, their experiences and career prospects.

items.label: Communities of practice
items.description: Groups of healthcare professionals who share knowledge and expertise in specific areas.

items.label: Health literacy
items.description: The ability of individuals to understand and use health information to make informed decisions.

items.label: Help and guidance
items.description: Resources providing support and direction for healthcare professionals and patients.

items.label: Impact and value
items.description: Measuring the impact and value of healthcare interventions and programs.

items.label: Industry
items.description: The healthcare industry, trends and related information.

items.label: Innovation
items.description: New ideas and approaches to improve healthcare delivery and outcomes.

items.label: Inter library loan and document supply
items.description: Obtaining health information resources from other libraries and providers.

items.label: Knowledge for Healthcare
items.description: Initiatives for promoting knowledge sharing and evidence-based practice in healthcare.

items.label: Learning and development
items.description: Activities and resources for healthcare education and training.

items.label: Learning zone
items.description: Online platforms for health education and training.

items.label: LibKey Nomad
items.description: A browser extension that provides direct access to full-text articles from library subscriptions.

items.label: Library management systems
items.description: Software for managing library resources and services.

items.label: Literature searching
items.description: Strategies and techniques for finding relevant health information in the literature.

items.label: Managing talent
items.description: Strategies for effectively attracting, developing, and retaining healthcare professionals.

items.label: Marketing and campaigns
items.description: Promotional activities to raise awareness of health services and programs.

items.label: Mentoring
items.description: Guidance and support provided by experienced healthcare professionals to those early in their career.

items.label: Mergers
items.description: Mergers of healthcare institutions.

items.label: Mobilising evidence and knowledge
items.description: Strategies for translating research evidence into practice.

items.label: Networking
items.description: Health specific networking events.

items.label: NHS and healthcare systems
items.description: Information about these systems.

items.label: NHS Digital Academy
items.description: A program for developing digital skills in healthcare leaders.

items.label: Occupational frameworks
items.description: Frameworks for defining roles and skills in the healthcare workforce.

items.label: Open access

items.label: Patient information

items.description: A framework for defining the knowledge and skills required for healthcare professionals.

items.description: Health related work placements.

items.label: Professional networks
items.description: Networks of healthcare professionals with specific skills.

items.description: Information relating to improving health quality.

items.label: Quality and Improvement Outcomes
items.description: Measuring and improving the quality of healthcare services and outcomes.

items.description: Health research findings and publications.
